Detailed Description

The class ShutDown is used by APOXI to handle the shutdown procedure. Any MMI application, which wants to invoke a system shutdown, has to use System::ShutDown()

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum ShutDown::Mode
 

Defines the shut-down behavior when ShutDown::Execute is called.

Enumerator:
PowerOff 
Restart  phone powers off after shut-down
SilentReset  restart
FirmwareUpdate  phone restarts in firmware update mode after shut-down

Member Function Documentation

void ShutDown::Execute (  Mode  mode = PowerOff  )  [static]
 

This method is called by System::ShutDown an will handle the whole shutdown process. The AppCloseMsg will be posted to all applications (OnClose will be called). Then the System will be checked periodically until all AppContainer are terminated. After that the Mobile Network will be stopped and the power down request is sent to the protocol stack.

void ShutDown::PowerDown (  BOOLEAN  restart = FALSE  )  [static]
 

This method simply turns off the power of the phone without doing any defined system clean up. If the flag restart is enabled, the phone will boot up again (currently) in 'normal mode' (kind of simulated ON-key press). It is mainly of internal use and should not be used for normal system shutdowns.
